other synonyms for "semantic" or "semantics" when referring to language parts that carry meaning.

Here are some synonyms for "semantic" or "semantics" in the context of language:

‚Ä¢ Meaning - relating to the meaning or meanings of words, phrases, sentences, etc.

‚Ä¢ Sense - the meaning or interpretation of a word, sentence, etc.

‚Ä¢ Significance - the meaning, importance or purpose of something.

‚Ä¢ Purport - the meaning, import, or sense of something. 

‚Ä¢ Implication - a possible meaning or interpretation of something.

‚Ä¢ Connotation - an idea or feeling that a word invokes in addition to its literal or primary meaning.

‚Ä¢ Nuance - a subtle difference or distinction in expression, meaning, response, etc.

‚Ä¢ Denotation - the literal or primary meaning of a word, in contrast to the feelings or ideas that the word suggests.

‚Ä¢ Reference - the actual thing, idea, etc. to which a word, phrase, or symbol refers.

‚Ä¢ Gist - the essence or main point of something; the substance or general meaning.

‚Ä¢ Import - meaning or significance, especially of a word, phrase, or action.

‚Ä¢ Thrust - the central theme or main meaning of something.

‚Ä¢ Tenor - the general meaning, sense, or purport of something.

‚Ä¢ Drift - the general meaning, purport, or tendency of something.

So in summary, semantics relates to meaning, sense, significance, implication, connotation, nuance, reference, gist, import, thrust, tenor, drift, etc. - the aspects of language that convey meaning and purpose.
